body.head: Richard von Kralik (born Eleonorenhain, Bohemia, Oct 1, 1852; did Vienna, Feb 4, 1934)

div.p: Richard von Kralik (born Eleonorenhain, Bohemia, Oct 1, 1852; did Vienna, Feb 4, 1934), independent writer, music and theater critic, and author of historical works. Kralik lived in Vienna from 1870, and taught "aesthetics of church music" at the Vienna Akademie für Musik und darstellende Kunst from 1910 to 1923. He was an influential representative of catholic-conservative values, and enjoyed a high posthumous reputation in the Austro-fascist corporative state (1934-38).
